info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 01 at 7:01PM CDT until May 01 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Randall County in the Panhandle of Texas... Southeastern Oldham County in the Panhandle of Texas... Northeastern Deaf Smith County in the Panhandle of Texas... Potter County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 800 PM CDT. * At 659 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles northwest of Umbarger, or 15 miles west of Canyon, moving northeast at 55 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR AREAS ALONG I-40 WEST OF I-27 TO WILDORADO. HAZARD...Three inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported baseball size hail in Hereford and near Umbarger. Widespread damage was reported in Hereford due to hail and wind. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be severely injured. Expect shattered windows, extensive damage to roofs, siding, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Bushland, Buffalo Lake, Dawn, Valley De Oro, Umbarger, Wildorado and Mescalero Park. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...3.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: This is a dangerous storm. Prepare immediately for large destructive hail capable of producing significant damage. People outside should move to shelter inside a strong building, and stay away from windows.
